storyInfo: Leto and the Viscount travel together and board the train to Lake Silberneherze. Receiving intelligence that something could be amiss on the train, the spy Trilby Asher boards, while Degenbrecher leaps on in search of someone. Let this most thrilling ride begin.

attributes.content: Hrrh! Hah!
attributes.name: Burly Tschäggättä

attributes.content: *pant*... *pant*...
attributes.name: Out-of-Breath Tschäggättä

attributes.content: Hah....! Hraggh!
attributes.name: Exhausted Tschäggättä

attributes.content: Take this!
attributes.name: Pumped-Up Tschäggättä

attributes.content: Haah—! Charge!
attributes.name: Tschäggättä

attributes.content: Have none of you had anything to eat today?
Again.
Ma'am... W-We can't anymore. We're spent...
attributes.name: Exhausted Tschäggättä

attributes.content: Get up.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: What did I teach you?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Stand up, and grip your weapons tight!
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Yes, ma'am!
attributes.name: Pumped-Up Tschäggättä

attributes.content: *pant*... *pant*... Hargh!
attributes.name: Out-of-Breath Tschäggättä

attributes.content: Too slow, and not enough force. Your Arts are too rushed, and your tactics too inflexible.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: There's some synergy among you. That's about it.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Overall, you're still too weak.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Of course we're no match for you...
attributes.name: Burly Tschäggättä

attributes.content: *huff*... *pant*...
attributes.name: Exhausted Tschäggättä

attributes.content: A compliment from you makes this training more than worth it.
attributes.name: Exhausted Tschäggättä

attributes.content: That's not enough! One day, I'll shatter a boulder with a single bare hand just like you, ma'am!
attributes.name: Pumped-Up Tschäggättä

attributes.content: Just you alone...
attributes.name: Out-of-Breath Tschäggättä

attributes.content: Looks like you've had enough rest.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Do it again.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Huh—?!
attributes.name: Tschäggättä

attributes.content: Ma'am! This is bad!
attributes.name: Frantic Tschäggättä

attributes.content: Don't panic.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: *pant*... *pant*...
attributes.name: Frantic Tschäggättä

attributes.content: Phew...
attributes.name: Frantic Tschäggättä

attributes.content: What happened?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: There's trouble!
attributes.name: Frantic Tschäggättä

attributes.content: Things are looking bad at the foot of the mountain... We can't handle it on our own!
attributes.name: Frantic Tschäggättä

attributes.content: It's real serious, ma'am! You should head right over!
attributes.name: Frantic Tschäggättä

attributes.content: Whoa! It's starting to move!
attributes.name: Mischievous Child

attributes.content: Hahahahaha! Mom, hurry!
attributes.name: Mischievous Child

attributes.content: —Wah!
attributes.name: Mischievous Child

attributes.content: That's why I told you not to run around on the train! Are you hurt?!
attributes.name: Irritated Mother

attributes.content: (Shakes head)
attributes.name: Mischievous Child

attributes.content: Look, Mom! A foreigner with a funny hat!
attributes.name: Mischievous Child

attributes.content: Don't say things like that! And don't point at people! The Saintess has no patience for rude children! Now apologize!
attributes.name: Irritated Mother

attributes.content: I'm sorry...
attributes.name: Mischievous Child

attributes.content: I am truly sorry, Sir. You'll have to forgive my boy.
attributes.name: Irritated Mother

attributes.content: No bother.
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: Please excuse me. My seat is just up ahead.
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: (The train is, evidently, above capacity.)
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: (Roughly half locals and half sightseers. Hm, peculiar for a sightseeing train.)
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: (The sacks in the corner at the back seem strange, too... There's movement inside. Contraband livestock, perhaps?)
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: (Hm, no other abnormalities, and no strange characters worth keeping an eye on...)
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: (Intelligence mentions nothing other than a train ride to Lake Silberneherze. Indeed, there are no apparent clues.)
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: (I should find the opportunity to inspect the cabins...)
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: *Thump*.
*Thump* *thump*.
For the past few moments, he has been feeling a kind of strange tremor in his seatback.
Is there perhaps some strange beast that kicks seatbacks on Kjerag's trains?
*thump* *thump* *thump*.
As though dissatisfied with his indifference, the kicking intensifies.
After a moment, the child sitting behind him pokes his head out.
Mister Funny Hat, Mister Funny Hat.
attributes.name: Mischievous Child

attributes.content: Are you some kind of train freak? I saw you two days ago, too!
attributes.name: Mischievous Child

attributes.content: You saw me...?
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: Yep!
attributes.name: Mischievous Child

attributes.content: Mister, did you fall in love with trains because you had never seen tracks or trains?
attributes.name: Mischievous Child

attributes.content: Ahem.
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: Mister, why did you clear your throat? It's okay. I'm not gonna make fun of you.
attributes.name: Mischievous Child

attributes.content: This train is really amazing. I love it, too! Mom told me that it's all thanks to the amazing Saintess and Sir Enciodes and how Kjeragandr has blessed us all!
attributes.name: Mischievous Child

attributes.content: How about... I lend you my model train? We can play trains! We'll drive a train together!
attributes.name: Mischievous Child

attributes.content: Put your toys away! Go back to your seat and stop bothering strangers!
attributes.name: Irritated Mother

attributes.content: I'm truly, terribly sorry that he bothered you again.
attributes.name: Irritated Mother

attributes.content: Rest assured, I'll teach him some manners!
attributes.name: Irritated Mother

attributes.content: No, it's fine...
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: (This hat...)
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: (Does it really look so strange?)
attributes.name: Foreigner With a Funny Hat

attributes.content: There are quite a few passengers today. It seems this new Kjeragandr statue is very popular!
attributes.name: Harold
Harold
attributes.content: Every time I get on the trains here, it reminds me of the arenas of the Kazimierz Major—

attributes.name: Harold
attributes.content: Yow! Something bit my toe!
Is this... a fowlbeast?
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: (Biting hard)
attributes.name: Runaway Fowlbeast

attributes.content: O-Ow-Oww, please have mercy, fowlbeast!
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Hey!
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: You're going to just let it go?
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: You sure that's alright? I'm pretty sure pets aren't allowed on the train.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Indeed, that's the rule, but not everything is inspected so closely. They do cut their fellow countrymen some slack every now and then.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Relax. This kind of fowlbeast is usually kept in sacks. It should be no problem.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Let us speak of other things. Come, young lady, my cabin is just ahead.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Phew... Hah!
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Finally, a seat! It was so crowded back there!
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: I didn't expect tickets for this train to be so hard to come by. Thanks for the help, dedushka!
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: It was the least I could do, young lady.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: No need for the fancy title. Just call me Rosalind.
attributes.name: Leto
Harold
attributes.content: As the young lady wishes...

attributes.name: Harold
attributes.content: 'Rosalind.' It's a name that suits you well. A riveting sound to it.
It is pretty great, isn't it? My mamochka picked it.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: What do I call you?
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: My name is Harold. Of course, you can also keep calling me 'dedushka,' if please you.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: You're very lucky. Had you missed this train, you likely would not make it to Lake Silberneherze in time.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: For real?
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Hehe, good thing I made it, then.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: You're heading to Lake Silberneherze too, aren't you? What are you doing there?
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: I believe I've already answered this question?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Kjerag's landscapes are truly magnificent. Of course I must feast my eyes upon the sights she has to offer.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: You can't fool me. There's not a single guy in your whole gang who looks like a tourist.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: We don't look the part to you?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Nope.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Uh, you look more like you came looking for trouble.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Ah, haha. Us? Perish the thought!
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I'm so enamored of Kjerag's scenery and culture. I'm even contemplating spending my retirement here!
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Yes, right, so long as there are no major issues, we shall remain nothing but tourists, naturally...
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: And what if—
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: —How about you, Rosalind?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: You speak the Kjerag tongue fairly well for a tourist. Is this your first time here?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Somebody's changing the subject hard and fast!
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Hah.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Whatever. I didn't get to this part, did I?
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: You could call me half Kjerag, even if I don't really feel like one at all. I grew up in Ursus with my mamochka.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Oh, so your mother is Ursine?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Yep, but she told me I was born in Kjerag, and my papa is from here...
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: I don't remember much about anything that happened when I was a kid. I guess you could call this a vacation.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Hmm, I see.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: By the way, I've been meaning to ask since we met...
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: What is that box you are holding, Rosalind?
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Oh, this...?
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Forgive me. If that intrudes upon your privacy in any way, you need not answer.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: It's okay. It's not really a secret or anything. I'm just figuring out how to explain it...
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: It's something that... my mamochka left to me.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: My...
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Please accept my condolences.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: I am sorry to raise such a painful topic, Rosalind.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Truly sorry.
attributes.name: Harold

attributes.content: Hmph, what's so painful about this?
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: I'm here to fulfill Mamochka's wishes.
attributes.name: Leto

attributes.content: Madam Degenbrecher, I...
attributes.name: Burdenbeast Herder

attributes.content: Everything is okay now.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: I've taken care of everything that needs taking care of.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Thank you so much, Madam.
attributes.name: Burdenbeast Herder

attributes.content: If it wasn't for you, who knows what would have happened to me? Thank Kjeragandr I'm still alive.
attributes.name: Burdenbeast Herder

attributes.content: This is all that I can do.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Sorry. It's not... a pretty sight.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: *sigh*. There wasn't any other way...
attributes.name: Burdenbeast Herder

attributes.content: Ma'am, you have blood all over you. Maybe you should clean up first?
attributes.name: Tschäggättä

attributes.content: Later.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Time is of the essence. Even though I may have solved the problem for now, I can't guarantee this will be the end of it.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: The most important thing is to find the one we're looking for.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: But, ma'am, we got news that they're already leaving the station.
attributes.name: Tschäggättä

attributes.content: Asking the railway to stop the train would only cause a panic.
attributes.name: Tschäggättä

attributes.content: Stop the train?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: There's no need for that.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: What else can we do?
attributes.name: Tschäggättä

attributes.content: Look down.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Wait...
attributes.name: Tschäggättä

attributes.content: The train is about to pass right under us!
attributes.name: Tschäggättä

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Wait, m-ma'am?!
attributes.name: Tschäggättä

attributes.content: Her figure as she descends upon the train seems both lighter than snow and heavier than stone.
Right then.
attributes.name: Degenbrecher

attributes.content: Where might they be?
attributes.name: Degenbrecher
